Announcement

announcement.Rmd
Duke FinTech Annual InterCollegiate Trading Competition
The annual trading competition sponsored by Duke’s Master of Engineering in FinTech program kicks off this month supported by some extraordinary companies.
This annual event welcomes students from schools across the globe to compete against their peers for cash prizes, and maybe more important, bragging rights. To better reflect the nature of the program the winner is selected by risk adjusted return (Sharpe Ratio), rather than simply total return. This provides students with the opportunity to test out unique quantitative algorithms and other methodologies.
This year’s competition is led again by Professor Jake Vestal and features all of the listed asset classes that one might expect, but also cryptocurrencies, in collaboration with the Student Trading Lab at Interactive Brokers. Here is a list of the schools of the early registrants:

Beijing University of Technology

Boston University

Carnegie Mellon University

Case Western Reserve University
